title: They are the same
content: SSG (Static Site Generation) renders pages at build time. SSR (Server-Side Rendering) renders on every request.
explanation: SSG is faster and cacheable; SSR is for dynamic, user-specific content.

options.text: SSG: build-time render; SSR: per-request render
SSR is always faster than SSG
SSG doesn't support dynamic data
They are the same

content: The App Router is a new routing system in Next.js 13+ based on the App/ directory, React Server Components, and nested layouts.
explanation: It replaces the Pages Router with a more powerful, server-first architecture that supports streaming, partial rendering, and built-in data fetching.

options.text: The App Router uses the app/ directory with file-based routing, React Server Components by default, and supports nested layouts via layout.js files.
options.explanation: It replaces the Pages Router with a more powerful, server-first architecture that supports streaming, partial rendering, and built-in data fetching.

content: Use redirect() from next/navigation in Server Components, or useRouter().push() in Client Components.
explanation: redirect() is for server-side redirects (e.g., auth checks); useRouter is for client-side navigation.
